<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Push-Pop Acceleration (PPX) hint is used to indicate that the POP reads the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value written by the PUSH from the stack. The processor tracks these marked</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions internally and fast-forwards register data between matching PUSH</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and POP instructions, without going through memory or through the training</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop of the Fast Store Forwarding Predictor (FSFP). Instead, a more efficient</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memory-renaming optimization can be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The PPX hint is purely a performance hint. Instructions with this hint have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the same functional semantics as those without. PPX hints set by the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compiler that violate the balancing rule may turn off the PPX optimization,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but they will not affect program semantics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Hence, PPX is used for balanced spill/reloads (Exceptions and setjmp/longjmp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are not considered).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PUSH2 and POP2 are instructions for (respectively) pushing/popping 2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// GPRs at a time to/from the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160" lineLink="#aef1cc59e277ff82741aa24e3e170ee04"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#aef1cc59e277ff82741aa24e3e170ee04">getPUSHOpcode</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86subtarget">X86Subtarget</a> &amp;ST) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ST.is64Bit() ? (ST.hasPPX() ? X86::PUSHP64r : X86::PUSH64r)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">                      : X86::PUSH32r;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need to exit with RSP modified by this amount and execute suitable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    if FinalReg &gt;= LimitReg goto ContinueMBB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// RoundBB:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1476"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1477"><Highlight kind="comment">/// emitPrologue - Push callee-saved registers onto the stack, which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1478"><Highlight kind="comment">/// automatically adjust the stack pointer. Adjust the stack pointer to allocate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1479"><Highlight kind="comment">/// space for local variables. Also emit labels used by the exception handler to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1480"><Highlight kind="comment">/// generate the exception handling frames.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><Highlight kind="comment">  Here&#39;s a gist of what gets emitted:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Establish frame pointer, if needed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if needs FP&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><Highlight kind="comment">      push  %rbp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><Highlight kind="comment">      .cfi&#95;def&#95;cfa&#95;offset 16</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><Highlight kind="comment">      .cfi&#95;offset %rbp, -16</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1490"><Highlight kind="comment">      .seh&#95;pushreg %rpb</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1491"><Highlight kind="comment">      mov  %rsp, %rbp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1492"><Highlight kind="comment">      .cfi&#95;def&#95;cfa&#95;register %rbp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1493"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1494"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Spill general-purpose registers</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1495"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;for all callee-saved GPRs&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1496"><Highlight kind="comment">      pushq %&lt;reg&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1497"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;if not needs FP&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1498"><Highlight kind="comment">         .cfi&#95;def&#95;cfa&#95;offset (offset from RETADDR)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1499"><Highlight kind="comment">      .seh&#95;pushreg %&lt;reg&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1500"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1501"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; If the required stack alignment &gt; default stack alignment</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1502"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; rsp needs to be re-aligned.  This creates a &quot;re-alignment gap&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1503"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; of unknown size in the stack frame.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1504"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if stack needs re-alignment&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1505"><Highlight kind="comment">      and  $MASK, %rsp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1506"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Allocate space for locals</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1508"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if target is Windows and allocated space &gt; 4096 bytes&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1509"><Highlight kind="comment">      ; Windows needs special care for allocations larger</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1510"><Highlight kind="comment">      ; than one page.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1511"><Highlight kind="comment">      mov $NNN, %rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1512"><Highlight kind="comment">      call &#95;&#95;&#95;chkstk&#95;ms/&#95;&#95;&#95;chkstk</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1513"><Highlight kind="comment">      sub  %rax, %rsp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1514"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;else&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1515"><Highlight kind="comment">      sub  $NNN, %rsp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1516"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1517"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if needs FP&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1518"><Highlight kind="comment">      .seh&#95;stackalloc (size of XMM spill slots)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1519"><Highlight kind="comment">      .seh&#95;setframe %rbp, SEHFrameOffset ; = size of all spill slots</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1520"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;else&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1521"><Highlight kind="comment">      .seh&#95;stackalloc NNN</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1522"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1523"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Spill XMMs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1524"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Note, that while only Windows 64 ABI specifies XMMs as callee-preserved,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1525"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; they may get spilled on any platform, if the current function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1526"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; calls @llvm.eh.unwind.init</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1527"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if needs FP&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1528"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;for all callee-saved XMM registers&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1529"><Highlight kind="comment">          movaps  %&lt;xmm reg&gt;, -MMM(%rbp)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1530"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;for all callee-saved XMM registers&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1531"><Highlight kind="comment">          .seh&#95;savexmm %&lt;xmm reg&gt;, (-MMM + SEHFrameOffset)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1532"><Highlight kind="comment">              ; i.e. the offset relative to (%rbp - SEHFrameOffset)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1533"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;else&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1534"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;for all callee-saved XMM registers&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><Highlight kind="comment">          movaps  %&lt;xmm reg&gt;, KKK(%rsp)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1536"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;for all callee-saved XMM registers&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><Highlight kind="comment">          .seh&#95;savexmm %&lt;xmm reg&gt;, KKK</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><Highlight kind="comment">  .seh&#95;endprologue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if needs base pointer&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542"><Highlight kind="comment">      mov  %rsp, %rbx</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1543"><Highlight kind="comment">      &#91;if needs to restore base pointer&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1544"><Highlight kind="comment">          mov %rsp, -MMM(%rbp)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1545"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1546"><Highlight kind="comment">  ; Emit CFI info</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1547"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#91;if needs FP&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack. It holds a pointer to the bottom of the root function frame.  The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// establisher frame pointer passed to a nested funclet may point to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (mostly empty) frame of its parent funclet, but it will need to find</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the frame of the root function to access locals.  To facilitate this,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// every funclet copies the pointer to the bottom of the root function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2323"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// frame into a PSPSym slot in its own (mostly empty) stack frame. Using the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2324"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// same offset for the PSPSym in the root function frame that&#39;s used in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2325"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// funclets&#39; frames allows each funclet to dynamically accept any ancestor</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// frame as its establisher argument (the runtime doesn&#39;t guarantee the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2327"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// immediate parent for some reason lost to history), and also allows the GC,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2328"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which uses the PSPSym for some bookkeeping, to find it in any funclet&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2751"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LLVM arranges the stack as follows:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2752"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2753"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ARG2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2754"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ARG1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2755"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   RETADDR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2756"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   PUSH RBP   &lt;-- RBP points here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2757"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   PUSH CSRs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2758"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ~~~~~~~    &lt;-- possible stack realignment (non-win64)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2759"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2760"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   STACK OBJECTS</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2761"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...        &lt;-- RSP after prologue points here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2762"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ~~~~~~~    &lt;-- possible stack realignment (win64)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2763"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2764"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if (hasVarSizedObjects()):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2765"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...        &lt;-- &quot;base pointer&quot; (ESI/RBX) points here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2766"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   DYNAMIC ALLOCAS</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2767"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...        &lt;-- RSP points here</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2768"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2769"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Case 1: In the simple case of no stack realignment and no dynamic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2770"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allocas, both &quot;fixed&quot; stack objects (arguments and CSRs) are addressable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2771"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with fixed offsets from RSP.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2772"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2773"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Case 2: In the case of stack realignment with no dynamic allocas, fixed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2774"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack objects are addressed with RBP and regular stack objects with RSP.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2775"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2776"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Case 3: In the case of dynamic allocas and stack realignment, RSP is used</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2777"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to address stack arguments for outgoing calls and nothing else. The &quot;base</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2778"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointer&quot; points to local variables, and RBP points to fixed objects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2779"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2780"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In cases 2 and 3, we can only answer for non-fixed stack objects, and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2781"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// answer we give is relative to the SP after the prologue, and not the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2782"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SP in the middle of the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2783"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2784"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#ae6e7e975f7a4e5d535be32068a7c67df">isFixedObjectIndex</a>(FI) &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#a1b652b91e12384b9f49bb38521b78ffe">TRI</a>-&gt;hasStackRealignment(MF) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2795"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#ab7feae1932b436c8630e247166ec42b7">getInfo</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86machinefunctioninfo">X86MachineFunctionInfo</a>&gt;()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86machinefunctioninfo/#a7c7a3251bd6c1b0b89e5712c89aaa305">getTCReturnAddrDelta</a>() &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2796"><Highlight kind="normal">         </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;we don&#39;t handle this case!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2797"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2798"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is how the math works out:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2799"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2800"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  %rsp grows (i.e. gets lower) left to right. Each box below is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2801"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  one word (eight bytes).  Obj0 is the stack slot we&#39;re trying to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2802"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  get to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2803"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2804"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ----------------------------------</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2805"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    | BP | Obj0 | Obj1 | ... | ObjN |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2806"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ----------------------------------</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2807"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ^    ^      ^                   ^</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2808"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    A    B      C                   E</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2809"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2810"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A is the incoming stack pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2811"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (B - A) is the local area offset (-8 for x86-64) &#91;1&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (C - A) is the Offset returned by MFI.getObjectOffset for Obj0 &#91;2&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |(E - B)| is the StackSize (absolute value, positive).  For a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2815"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack that grown down, this works out to be (B - E). &#91;3&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2817"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// E is also the value of %rsp after stack has been set up, and we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2818"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// want (C - E) -- the value we can add to %rsp to get to Obj0.  Now</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2819"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (C - E) == (C - A) - (B - A) + (B - E)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2820"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            &#123; Using &#91;1&#93;, &#91;2&#93; and &#91;3&#93; above &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2821"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         == getObjectOffset - LocalAreaOffset + StackSize</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2822"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#a79ebbed1ceecae3f74214e33fc8c533f">getFrameIndexReferenceSP</a>(MF, FI, FrameReg, StackSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2824"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2825"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3449"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Under the large code model, we cannot assume that &#95;&#95;morestack lives</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3450"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// within 2^31 bytes of the call site, so we cannot use pc-relative</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3451"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addressing. We cannot perform the call via a temporary register,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3452"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as the rax register may be used to store the static chain, and all</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3453"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other suitable registers may be either callee-save or used for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3454"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// parameter passing. We cannot use the stack at this point either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3455"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because &#95;&#95;morestack manipulates the stack directly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3456"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3457"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To avoid these issues, perform an indirect call via a read-only memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3458"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// location containing the address.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3459"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3460"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This solution is not perfect, as it assumes that the .rodata section</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3461"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is laid out within 2^31 bytes of each function body, but this seems</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3462"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be sufficient for JIT.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3463"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Add retpoline support and remove the error here..</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3533"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Erlang programs may need a special prologue to handle the stack size they</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3534"><Highlight kind="comment">/// might need at runtime. That is because Erlang/OTP does not implement a C</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4006"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#abac406e51bd21d4da6eb9762f2f36df6">getInitialCFARegister</a>(MF) == FrameRegister &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4010"><Highlight kind="normal">    FrameBase.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetframelowering/dwarfframebase/#a82acb7f3bcf1d1f621a2afbcc936e85b">Location</a>.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetframelowering/dwarfframebase/#a0f3e9e851be1c3d4d7276752c0c2d330">Offset</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4011"><Highlight kind="normal">        -MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a54f334a9c8ca6d105eae383ae87e4524">getFrameInfo</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a14c39a24bf6ebbe339ae8a453c7fdd11">getStackSize</a>() - <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#a5f9f26d96deb10d0d3b394fe12e2b0f5">getInitialCFAOffset</a>(MF);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4012"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FrameBase;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4013"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4014"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4015"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetframelowering/dwarfframebase">DwarfFrameBase</a>&#123;DwarfFrameBase::Register, &#123;FrameRegister&#125;&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4016"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4017"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4018" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-x86framelowering-cpp-"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4019"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Struct used by orderFrameObjects to help sort the stack objects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4020" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject">X86FrameSortingObject</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4021" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#a6737e591c015571f3c938c4a28e16354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#a6737e591c015571f3c938c4a28e16354">IsValid</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;             </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// true if we care about this Object.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4022" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#aa0332712911e5a7f078a096647d2ea8d"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#aa0332712911e5a7f078a096647d2ea8d">ObjectIndex</a> = 0;         </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Index of Object into MFI list.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4023" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#afaac64eeb0dd06d8c9c554b814de9e0a"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#afaac64eeb0dd06d8c9c554b814de9e0a">ObjectSize</a> = 0;          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Size of Object in bytes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4024" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#ae91c6bbcc0f99ad44f39be523066b801"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#ae91c6bbcc0f99ad44f39be523066b801">ObjectAlignment</a> = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(1); </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Alignment of Object in bytes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4025" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#ac90fef00f2a9a8d67a65fa937a546667"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject/#ac90fef00f2a9a8d67a65fa937a546667">ObjectNumUses</a> = 0;       </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Object static number of uses.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4026"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4027"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4028"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The comparison function we use for std::sort to order our local</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4029"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack symbols. The current algorithm is to use an estimated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4030"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;density&quot;. This takes into consideration the size and number of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4031"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// uses each object has in order to roughly minimize code size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4032"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So, for example, an object of size 16B that is referenced 5 times</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4033"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will get higher priority than 4 4B objects referenced 1 time each.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4034"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It&#39;s not perfect and we may be able to squeeze a few more bytes out of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4035"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it (for example : 0(esp) requires fewer bytes, symbols allocated at the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4036"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fringe end can have special consideration, given their size is less</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4037"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// important, etc.), but the algorithmic complexity grows too much to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4038"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// worth the extra gains we get. This gets us pretty close.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4039"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The final order leaves us with objects with highest priority going</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4040"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// at the end of our list.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4041" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingcomparator"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingcomparator">X86FrameSortingComparator</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4042" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingcomparator/#aa40e5377007cb04e6d574ee076ecff22"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingcomparator/#aa40e5377007cb04e6d574ee076ecff22">operator()</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject">X86FrameSortingObject</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4043"><Highlight kind="normal">                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-x86framelowering-cpp-/x86framesortingobject">X86FrameSortingObject</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4044"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t DensityAScaled, DensityBScaled;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4045"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4046"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For consistency in our comparison, all invalid objects are placed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4047"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// at the end. This also allows us to stop walking when we hit the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4048"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first invalid item after it&#39;s all sorted.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4049"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.IsValid)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4050"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4051"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.IsValid)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4052"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4053"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4054"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The density is calculated by doing :</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4055"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     (double)DensityA = A.ObjectNumUses / A.ObjectSize</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4056"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     (double)DensityB = B.ObjectNumUses / B.ObjectSize</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4057"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since this approach may cause inconsistencies in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4058"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the floating point &lt;, &gt;, == comparisons, depending on the floating</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4059"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point model with which the compiler was built, we&#39;re going</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4060"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to scale both sides by multiplying with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4061"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A.ObjectSize &#42; B.ObjectSize. This ends up factoring away</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4062"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the division and, with it, the need for any floating point</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4063"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// arithmetic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4064"><Highlight kind="normal">    DensityAScaled = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectNumUses) &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4065"><Highlight kind="normal">                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4066"><Highlight kind="normal">    DensityBScaled = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectNumUses) &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4067"><Highlight kind="normal">                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4068"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4069"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the two densities are equal, prioritize highest alignment</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4070"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// objects. This allows for similar alignment objects</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4071"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be packed together (given the same density).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4072"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There&#39;s room for improvement here, also, since we can pack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4073"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// similar alignment (different density) objects next to each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4074"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other to save padding. This will also require further</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4075"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// complexity/iterations, and the overall gain isn&#39;t worth it,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4076"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in general. Something to keep in mind, though.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4077"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DensityAScaled == DensityBScaled)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4078"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>.ObjectAlignment &lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>.ObjectAlignment;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4079"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4080"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DensityAScaled &lt; DensityBScaled;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4081"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4082"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4083"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// namespace</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4084"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4085"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Order the symbols in the local stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4086"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We want to place the local stack objects in some sort of sensible order.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4087"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The heuristic we use is to try and pack them according to static number</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4088"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of uses and size of object in order to minimize code size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4089" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#adee8390bf727c3086a7b864de6c6913e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#adee8390bf727c3086a7b864de6c6913e">X86FrameLowering::orderFrameObjects</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4090"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;ObjectsToAllocate)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4091"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> &amp;MFI = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a54f334a9c8ca6d105eae383ae87e4524">getFrameInfo</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4092"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4093"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t waste time if there&#39;s nothing to do.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4094"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ObjectsToAllocate.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#ad9a3c7bc26b130377bbafc170b5f88a2">empty</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4095"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4096"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4097"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create an array of all MFI objects. We won&#39;t need all of these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4098"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// objects, but we&#39;re going to create a full array of them to make</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4099"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it easier to index into when we&#39;re counting &quot;uses&quot; down below.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We want to be able to easily/cheaply access an object by simply</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// indexing into it, instead of having to search for it every time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4102"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;X86FrameSortingObject&gt; SortingObjects(MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#ac51e2d34abb79b72afef355fac525c76">getObjectIndexEnd</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Walk the objects we care about and mark them as such in our working</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// struct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Obj : ObjectsToAllocate) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4107"><Highlight kind="normal">    SortingObjects&#91;Obj&#93;.IsValid = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4108"><Highlight kind="normal">    SortingObjects&#91;Obj&#93;.ObjectIndex = Obj;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4496"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If a function uses base pointer and the base pointer is clobbered by inline</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4497"><Highlight kind="comment">/// asm, RA doesn&#39;t detect this case, and after the inline asm, the base pointer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4498"><Highlight kind="comment">/// contains garbage value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4499"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example if a 32b x86 function uses base pointer esi, and esi is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4500"><Highlight kind="comment">/// clobbered by following inline asm</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4501"><Highlight kind="comment">///     asm(&quot;rep movsb&quot; : &quot;+D&quot;(ptr), &quot;+S&quot;(x), &quot;+c&quot;(c)::&quot;memory&quot;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4502"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We need to save esi before the asm and restore it after the asm.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4503"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4504"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The problem can also occur to frame pointer if there is a function call, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4505"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the callee uses a different calling convention and clobbers the fp.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4506"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4507"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Because normal frame objects (spill slots) are accessed through fp/bp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4508"><Highlight kind="comment">/// register, so we can&#39;t spill fp/bp to normal spill slots.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4509"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4510"><Highlight kind="comment">/// FIXME: There are 2 possible enhancements:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4511"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1 In many cases there are different physical registers not clobbered by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4512"><Highlight kind="comment">/// inline asm, we can use one of them as base pointer. Or use a virtual</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4513"><Highlight kind="comment">/// register as base pointer and let RA allocate a physical register to it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4514"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2 If there is no other instructions access stack with fp/bp from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4515"><Highlight kind="comment">/// inline asm to the epilog, and no cfi requirement for a correct fp, we can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4516"><Highlight kind="comment">/// skip the save and restore operations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4517" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#a068e9d1fd54621ae340f26c41d170a1a"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86framelowering/#a068e9d1fd54621ae340f26c41d170a1a">X86FrameLowering::spillFPBP</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4519"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a6a6d31b2f1e5754f5824c5dec555eeac">TargetFrameLowering</a> &amp;TFI = &#42;MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3825368aca2bc1550d173660df4da6a6">getSubtarget</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetsubtargetinfo/#ac83b44e69c9f9f4f9d60be2d72f4a5df">getFrameLowering</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
